m:properties.d:SpeakerDescription:
Brian Mitchell, an MCM - SQL 2008 with a MBA from the University of Florida, is a Senior Consultant in the Microsoft Big Data Center of Expertise, where he focuses on SQL Server Parallel Data Warehouse, HDInsight, and Microsoft Business Intelligence. Brian has spent countless hours onsite at customer sites delivering Microsoft database and BI solutions. He has extensive experience creating and delivering advanced training for the full range of the Microsoft BI stack, with a particular passion for Analysis Services and Reporting Services.
Brian has presented at TechEd, PASS Summit, SQLRally, and several SQLSaturdays and SQL Server user groups. You can read more about his deep involvement in Microsoft data technologies at http://brianwmitchell.com.

Joseph D'Antoni is a Senior Consultant and Microsoft Data Platform MVP with over 20 years of experience working in both Fortune 500 and smaller firms. He is a Principal Consultant for Denny Cherry & Associates and lives in Malvern, PA. He is a frequent speaker at major tech events like Microsoft Ignite, PASS Summit, and Enterprise Data World. He blogs about all topics technology at joeydantoni.com. He believes that no single platform is the answer to all technology problems. Joseph holds a BS in Computer Information Systems from Louisiana Tech University and an MBA from North Carolina State University, and is the co-author of the Microsoft book "Introducing SQL Server 2016”.

Ayad Shammout is a Database & BI Specialist and Microsoft MVP. He has more than 25 years deep experience in Database technologies and specializing in SQL Server, SharePoint, Windows OS. Shammout is working in OLTP design and development, Data Warehousing, Business Intelligence and Big Data, with extensive experience in data management and analysis. Ayad has been involved in many SQL Server Enterprise implementations for High-Availability, DR, Business Intelligence, Data Mining and Big Data.

Stacia Varga is a Microsoft Data Platform MVP and SSAS Maestro with a Bachelor’s Degree in Social Sciences. A consultant, educator, author, and principal of Data Inspirations, her career spans more than 30 years, with a focus on improving business practices through technology.
Since 2000, Stacia has provided consulting and education services for Microsoft's Business Intelligence technologies. As Stacia Misner, she also authored several books covering the Microsoft BI stack.

Stacia Varga is a Microsoft Data Platform MVP and SSAS Maestro with a Bachelor’s Degree in Social Sciences. A consultant, educator, author, and principal of Data Inspirations, her career spans more than 30 years, with a focus on improving business practices through technology.
Since 2000, Stacia has provided consulting and education services for Microsoft's Business Intelligence technologies. As Stacia Misner, she also authored several books covering the Microsoft BI stack.

Mark Tabladillo Ph.D. works for Microsoft as a Cloud Solution Architect for the US CTO Customer Success Team. He has a science doctorate from Georgia Tech. Based in Atlanta, GA, Mark provides cloud enterprise solutions for companies in the US for Microsoft's strategic clients. He is a chapter leader for the PASS Data Science virtual chapter.

Mark Tabladillo Ph.D. works for Microsoft as a Cloud Solution Architect for the US CTO Customer Success Team. He has a science doctorate from Georgia Tech. Based in Atlanta, GA, Mark provides cloud enterprise solutions for companies in the US for Microsoft's strategic clients. He is a chapter leader for the PASS Data Science virtual chapter.

Marco is a Business Intelligence consultant and mentor. He wrote several books about Power BI, Analysis Service, and Power Pivot. He also regularly writes articles and white papers that are available on sqlbi.com. Marco is a Microsoft MVP and an SSAS Maestro, the highest level of certification on Microsoft Analysis Services. Today, Marco focuses his time with SQLBI customers, traveling extensively to train and consult on DAX and data modeling for Power BI and Analysis Services. Marco also teaches public classes worldwide. Marco is a regular speaker at international conferences like Microsoft Ignite, PASS Summit, and SQLBits. He also enjoys delivering evening sessions at local user groups during his trips.

Marco is a Business Intelligence consultant and mentor. He wrote several books about Power BI, Analysis Service, and Power Pivot. He also regularly writes articles and white papers that are available on sqlbi.com. Marco is a Microsoft MVP and an SSAS Maestro, the highest level of certification on Microsoft Analysis Services. Today, Marco focuses his time with SQLBI customers, traveling extensively to train and consult on DAX and data modeling for Power BI and Analysis Services. Marco also teaches public classes worldwide. Marco is a regular speaker at international conferences like Microsoft Ignite, PASS Summit, and SQLBits. He also enjoys delivering evening sessions at local user groups during his trips.

Paul is a Principal Consultant for Pragmatic Works, a Mentor and Microsoft Data Platform MVP. He consults, writes, speaks, teaches & blogs about business intelligence and reporting solutions. He works with companies around the world to model data, visualize and deliver critical information to make informed business decisions; using the Microsoft data platform and business analytics tools. He is a Director of the Oregon Data Community PASS chapter & user group, the author and lead author of Professional SQL Server 2016 Reporting Services and 14 other titles from Wrox & Microsoft Press. He holds several certifications including MCSE for the Data Platform and BI.

Dave DuVarney is an independent business intelligence consultant and trainer. He has broad technical and functional BI knowledge and has worked with organizations across the full BI life cycle. Dave has helped clients establish their BI program and run Agile development teams. He specializes in SQL Server Analysis Services, Integration Services, and Reporting Services as well as .NET development.

Devin Knight a Microsoft Data Platform MVP and the Training Director at Pragmatic Works. He is an author of seven SQL Server and Business Intelligence books and speaks at conferences like PASS Summit, PASS Business Analytics Conference, SQL Saturdays and Code Camps. He is also a contributing member to several PASS Virtual Chapters. Making his home in Jacksonville, FL, Devin is the Vice President of the local Power BI User Group and SQL Server User Group (JSSUG).

Rob Collie is President and Founder of PowerPivotPro, a national consulting firm 100% dedicated to Power BI and the “Agile BI” methodology. A former engineering leader at Microsoft, Rob led the BI-focused team within Microsoft Excel, and later shaped Power Pivot v1 – the groundbreaking forerunner to Power BI. He is a sought-after speaker with a distinctive, down-to-earth style, and author of the world’s #1-selling Power BI book.

Doug Lane is the founder of SQL Theater, a company specializing in helping junior developers and public speakers. Doug has over 15 years' experience in IT and holds a Bachelor of Arts degree in Media Production. In addition to presenting at conferences, SQL Saturdays, and user group meetings, Doug also blogs and produces video training courses.

Neil Hambly is a SQL Server consultant, founder and consultant at Datamovements, a Gold Microsoft Data & Analytics Consulting company. Neil has 20+ years in a variety of SQL Server roles and is an MCT. He is a regular presenter (200+ events) at user groups, and PASS events, including PASS Summit and SQLSaturday, and many UK events (SQLBits, SQLRelay). Neil is the leader of PASS London (UK), a Professional Development VC, a Melissa Data MVP, and a SQL Cruise Technical Lead, who loves Guinness, whisky, and dancing.

Chris Webb is a member of the Power BI CAT team. He is the author of "Power Query for Power BI and Excel" and a co-author of "SQL Server Analysis Services 2012: The BISM Tabular Model", "Expert Cube Development with SQL Server 2008 Analysis Services", and "MDX Solutions with Microsoft SQL Server Analysis Services 2005 and Hyperion Essbase".

Craig Utley is a Senior Architect with CTS and a former Program Manager with the SQL Server Customer Advisory Team (SQLCAT), where he focused on business intelligence. Craig has been involved in the Microsoft BI space since the betas of SQL Server 7.0 and has consulted on over 50 BI implementations worldwide, including the largest Microsoft data warehouse in the world. He is a former MVP in both SQL Server and C# and has written three books and more than 35 articles.

Craig Utley is a Senior Architect with CTS and a former Program Manager with the SQL Server Customer Advisory Team (SQLCAT), where he focused on business intelligence. Craig has been involved in the Microsoft BI space since the betas of SQL Server 7.0 and has consulted on over 50 BI implementations worldwide, including the largest Microsoft data warehouse in the world. He is a former MVP in both SQL Server and C# and has written three books and more than 35 articles.

Hope Foley, a former Data Platform MVP, has worked across many industries as a DBA and Business Intelligence consultant. She joined team at Microsoft and is a Data & AI Technology Solutions Professional. She has worked with enterprise customers but now focuses on education. Hope is an active member in the SQL Server and PASS communities speaking at events and organizing the SQLSaturday event in Indianapolis.

Rod Colledge is the national BI practice lead for DWS, a leading publicly listed Australian IT Services company. With 15+ years of SQL Server experience, Rod's commitment and depth of knowledge was recognized in 2010 with a Microsoft MVP award for SQL Server. This is Rod's 6th consecutive year as an MVP. Rod has authored or contributed to three books, including the “SQL Server MVP Deep Dives” series. He's a sought-after speaker at both local and international SQL Server conferences.

Oliver Engels is CEO of oh22data AG, a Microsoft Gold Partner in Germany specializing in CRM and BI. His special interests are Azure, Data Governance and Integration, Visualisation Tools like SSRS, Power BI, Tableau, R, and SharePoint. He has worked with SQL Server since version 6.5 and is a founder and Board member of PASS Germany, a PASS Regional Mentor, and runs the Frankfurt PASS Local Group. For more than seven years he is a Microsoft Data Platform MVP and a Microsoft pTSP.

Jen Stirrup, Microsoft Regional Director and MVP is a well-known Business Intelligence and Data Visualization expert, author, data strategist, and Master of Business Administration (MBA) student in London. Jen leads a boutique analytics consultancy, delivering strategic advice to companies large and small.
Jen has presented in Africa, India, Europe and North America. Jen has presented at Ignite, Techorama, TechEd, PASS Summit, SQLBits, and SQLSaturday events in Europe and the US. She also delivers the MAPA Azure Architects course worldwide with Microsoft team members. Jen was also featured on the Best of PASS Summit 2015 DVD as one of the top 10 speakers. Jen also was awarded PASS prestigious PASSion Award in 2012

Jen Stirrup, Microsoft Regional Director and MVP is a well-known Business Intelligence and Data Visualization expert, author, data strategist, and Master of Business Administration (MBA) student in London. Jen leads a boutique analytics consultancy, delivering strategic advice to companies large and small.
Jen has presented in Africa, India, Europe and North America. Jen has presented at Ignite, Techorama, TechEd, PASS Summit, SQLBits, and SQLSaturday events in Europe and the US. She also delivers the MAPA Azure Architects course worldwide with Microsoft team members. Jen was also featured on the Best of PASS Summit 2015 DVD as one of the top 10 speakers. Jen also was awarded PASS prestigious PASSion Award in 2012

Cindy Gross is an Adaptive Community Leader & founder of Befriending Dragons. She nurtures equitable tech cultures where everyone thrives and belongs. That starts with a foundation where workplace bullies and harassers are not tolerated. Cindy has met many scary dragons in her life – breast cancer, divorce, a layoff, changing roles and technologies, workplace harassment as a Microsoft woman in tech, constant striving to meet some impossible to meet bar for success, and the idea that we always have to put work first. Most recently she left the corporate world to strike out on her own, into a rich community filled with people who create justice, meaning, allies, and dreams.

Brian Walker is a Solutions Architect on the Microsoft Consulting Services Parallel Data Warehouse Center of Excellence (CoE) team, which trains and mentors architects, consultants, and partners on the most effective solution architectures and data designs for the PDW environment.
Brian has over 13 years of experience in the enterprise data warehousing space for the Oracle and Teradata environments in the telecommunications and financial services industries, with a range of capabilities that spans business analytics, management information reporting, IT compliance, and production environment management. He also has extensive experience in the implementation of Massively Parallel Processing (MPP) enterprise data warehouse solutions leveraging DATAllegro and SQL Server 2008 R2 PDW appliances in the retail, manufacturing, and financial services industries.

Andrew Brust is Senior Director, Technical Product Marketing and Evangelism at Datameer (http://www.datameer.com) and writes a blog for ZDNet called "Big on Data" (http://www.zdnet.com/blog/big-data). Andrew is co-author of "Programming Microsoft SQL Server 2012" (Microsoft Press); an advisor to NYTECH, the New York Technology Council; serves as Microsoft Regional Director and MVP; and writes the Redmond Review column for VisualStudioMagazine.com.

Andrew Brust is Senior Director, Technical Product Marketing and Evangelism at Datameer (http://www.datameer.com) and writes a blog for ZDNet called "Big on Data" (http://www.zdnet.com/blog/big-data). Andrew is co-author of "Programming Microsoft SQL Server 2012" (Microsoft Press); an advisor to NYTECH, the New York Technology Council; serves as Microsoft Regional Director and MVP; and writes the Redmond Review column for VisualStudioMagazine.com.

Julie Koesmarno, MCSE Data Platform, and MCSE Business Intelligence, MCT, is a Senior Program Manager at Microsoft, with a Bachelor’s degree in IT. She has over 10 years of experience working with SQL Server for large-scale and multi-million-dollar OLTP and ETL projects as a SQL Server developer and system analyst/designer. Her past projects include delivering a SQL Server 2012 data warehouse and BI solutions in the US and Australia. She now works with hybrid, cloud and on-prem SQL projects.

Peter Myers is a consultant, trainer and presenter, and has worked with Microsoft database and development products since 1997. Today he specializes in all Microsoft Business Intelligence products and also authors training course content for Microsoft products and services.
He has a broad business background supported by a bachelor’s degree in applied economics and accounting, and he extends this with extensive experience backed by current MCSE certifications. He has been a Data Platform MVP since 2007.

Peter Myers is a consultant, trainer and presenter, and has worked with Microsoft database and development products since 1997. Today he specializes in all Microsoft Business Intelligence products and also authors training course content for Microsoft products and services.
He has a broad business background supported by a bachelor’s degree in applied economics and accounting, and he extends this with extensive experience backed by current MCSE certifications. He has been a Data Platform MVP since 2007.

Peter Myers is a consultant, trainer and presenter, and has worked with Microsoft database and development products since 1997. Today he specializes in all Microsoft Business Intelligence products and also authors training course content for Microsoft products and services.
He has a broad business background supported by a bachelor’s degree in applied economics and accounting, and he extends this with extensive experience backed by current MCSE certifications. He has been a Data Platform MVP since 2007.

Chuck Heinzelman is a Senior Program Manager with the Business Process Division (BPD) Customer Experience team at Microsoft, working with both the SQL Server Customer Advisory Team (SQLCAT) and the Community Strategy team. His primary focus areas in the SQL Server arena are database design, application development, and physical infrastructure.
Chuck has been involved with the SQL Server community for over 10 years. He was a founding member of the Wisconsin SQL Server User Group and has attended all but one PASS Summit. He has a long history of volunteering with PASS, having served as an author, editor, presenter, and former Board member.

Murshed Zaman is a Senior Program Manager in Microsoft Azure Customer Advisory Team working with ADLA/S, HDInsight, APS, ColumnStore in SQL Server 2014/2016, and SQL DW (PaaS DW offering from MSFT). Murshed's overall data warehousing experience spans more than 12 years, specializing in telecommunications, retail, web analytics and supply chain management. He has worked with Massively Parallel Processing (MPP) systems for over 8 years. In SQL DW, his main focus areas were E2E architecture design for DW and distributed query plan. Currently he is focused on helping customers with HDInsight, SQL DW, HDP on IAAS and hybrid data scenarios. Murshed has written many technical documents that are published on SQLCAT blog site on MSDN.

Denny Lee is a Principal Program Manager at Microsoft for the Azure DocumentDB team. He has extensive experience in distributed systems and data sciences with more than 18 years of experience developing large internet-scale infrastructure, data platforms, and distributed systems for both on-premise and cloud environments. Prior to joining the Azure DocumentDB, Denny worked as a Technology Evangelist at Databricks; he has been working with Apache Spark since 0.5. He was also the Senior Director of Data Sciences Engineering at Concur and he was on the incubation team that built Microsoft’s Hadoop on Windows and Azure service (currently known as HDInsight).

Denny Lee is a Principal Program Manager at Microsoft for the Azure DocumentDB team. He has extensive experience in distributed systems and data sciences with more than 18 years of experience developing large internet-scale infrastructure, data platforms, and distributed systems for both on-premise and cloud environments. Prior to joining the Azure DocumentDB, Denny worked as a Technology Evangelist at Databricks; he has been working with Apache Spark since 0.5. He was also the Senior Director of Data Sciences Engineering at Concur and he was on the incubation team that built Microsoft’s Hadoop on Windows and Azure service (currently known as HDInsight).

Kay Unkroth is a Senior Program Manager in the SQL Server Analysis Services team, focusing among other things on integrating SQL Server PowerPivot with SharePoint Server. In this engineering role, he works closely with customers, product management, field representatives, consultants, and support engineers to gather feedback, define target scenarios and functional requirements, develop program plans, and execute on them. Kay has 20 years of experience in the IT industry as a support engineer, consultant, developer, entrepreneur, and technical author.

Ashvini Sharma is the Group Program Manager in the Office Data Experiences team, the team responsible for delivering Office BI features such as pivot tables, external data connectivity, PowerPivot, and Power View, as well as spreadsheet compliance features such as Discovery and Risk assessment for workbooks and databases.
Previously, Ashvini held various roles within the SQL Server BI group, including working on the xVelocity engine and Integration Services. A graduate of Carnegie Mellon University, his professional career has been BI focused. Ashvini's secret to success is to change jobs before someone asks what you really do for a living, and to find as many opportunities to backpack as possible.

Ashvini Sharma is the Group Program Manager in the Office Data Experiences team, the team responsible for delivering Office BI features such as pivot tables, external data connectivity, PowerPivot, and Power View, as well as spreadsheet compliance features such as Discovery and Risk assessment for workbooks and databases.
Previously, Ashvini held various roles within the SQL Server BI group, including working on the xVelocity engine and Integration Services. A graduate of Carnegie Mellon University, his professional career has been BI focused. Ashvini's secret to success is to change jobs before someone asks what you really do for a living, and to find as many opportunities to backpack as possible.

James Serra is a big data and data warehousing solution architect at Microsoft. He is a thought leader in the use and application of Big Data and advanced analytics. Previously, James was an independent consultant working as a Data Warehouse/Business Intelligence architect and developer. He is a prior SQL Server MVP with over 35 years of IT experience. James is a popular blogger (JamesSerra.com) and speaker. He is the author of the book “Reporting with Microsoft SQL Server 2012”.

James Serra is a big data and data warehousing solution architect at Microsoft. He is a thought leader in the use and application of Big Data and advanced analytics. Previously, James was an independent consultant working as a Data Warehouse/Business Intelligence architect and developer. He is a prior SQL Server MVP with over 35 years of IT experience. James is a popular blogger (JamesSerra.com) and speaker. He is the author of the book “Reporting with Microsoft SQL Server 2012”.

Angel leads the Solutions Architecture team at DesignMind, helping design and build world class data-related systems. His expertise includes Microsoft SQL Server BI tools, Power BI, Azure-based database services, and Tableau. His team develops Proofs of Concept, Pilots, and highly scalable production systems. Angel co-leads the Bay Area Microsoft Business Intelligence User Group and the San Francisco Power BI User Group. He speaks at Data Analytics events throughout the U.S. and writes for SQL Server Central. He is a graduate of Cal Poly SLO with a BS in Mechanical Engineering.

Dan Clark is a senior data analytics consultant. He is focused on all things data analytics and training others how to get value from their data. Dan has published several books and numerous articles on .NET programming and data analytics. He is a regular speaker at various developer and database conferences and user group meetings and enjoys interacting with the Microsoft developer and database communities. His latest book Beginning Power BI published by Apress is a will get you up and running with self-service data analytics on the Power BI platform in no time.

Paco Gonzalez is the CEO of SolidQ North America, and a Microsoft Data Platform MVP. Focused on Business Analytics and Artificial Intelligence, he specializes in helping organizations become data driven from a strategic and technical perspective. Paco is a speaker at small and large conferences such as PASS Summit, Ignite, and Business Applications Summit, and he has published several books and whitepapers. He is based in Atlanta, GA.

Jason Thomas is a Microsoft Certified SQL Server professional with over 10 years of Microsoft BI experience. He is a BI Consultant for BlueGranite, based in Charlotte, NC. When he's not at work, Jason likes sharing his time between the MSDN forums (for which he was recognized with the Microsoft Community Contributor award), blogging about MSBI (www.SqlJason.com), speaking at SQL Server events, and watching movies with his wife (not necessarily in that order).

Mark is a Data Solutions Architect for Microsoft, helping organizations design data solutions in Azure. He has been working with Microsoft data technologies since 2007. Before joining Microsoft, he was a Business Intelligence consultant and two-time Microsoft Data Platform MVP. With a background in Theater and Improvised Comedy, Mark makes sure that his presentations are both informative and fun.

Josh Fennessy, Solution Architect at BlueGranite, has been building solutions with the SQL Server BI stack for 8 years. He is a Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert in Business Intelligence. Josh's passions include manipulating data in novel ways to open analytic possibilities not before possible.
Josh is active in the SQL Server and Open Source communities. Beyond relational and OLAP data projects, Josh is also involved in projects using cluster computing platforms such as Hadoop.

Riccardo Muti is a Group Program Manager for SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) at Microsoft. Since joining the Reporting Services team a little over a year ago, he's worked on overhauling and modernizing the product and integrating Datazen technology to deliver SSRS 2016. Today, he continues to work on delivering on Microsoft's on-premises BI roadmap, including an on-premises self-service BI solution built on Power BI Desktop reports.
Before joining the Reporting Services team, Riccardo worked on Power BI, guiding the design and delivery of core functionality such as the data visualization canvas and the ability to pin visualizations to dashboards for monitoring.
Riccardo is a regular speaker at PASS Summit and other conferences.

Faisal Mohamood is a Lead Program Manager in the Microsoft SQL Server Information Services Group, working on Microsoft Codename “Data Explorer.” His team is responsible for delivering end user experiences around data discovery, consumption, and data mashups. Before his current role, Faisal was a Program Manager on Entity Framework and LINQ to SQL, as part of the data programmability efforts at Microsoft. He also worked on the Visual Studio IDE team before being drawn into the wonderful world of data.

Tillmann Eitelberg is CEO and co-founder of oh22information services GmbH, which specializes in data integration and data management. Tillmann is an active blogger at www.ssis-components.net, writing regularly about data quality topics and his passion: spatial data. In addition, he has published several SSIS components on Codeplex and GitHub. Tillmann is a Data Platform MVP, a board member of PASS Germany e.V., a PASS CL for the Cologne/Bonn region, and a PASS RM.

Diego is a data geek with a passion for sports and cooking. He received his B.Sc and M.Sc in Information Systems Management from Carnegie Mellon University and has worked across multiple industries always in the area[[s]] of Business Intelligence. For the past five years he has been a Program Manager at Microsoft. During his tenure there he had the chance to deliver some of the most widely used software in the world including, Excel 2010, Excel 2013, SQL Server 2008 R2, SQL Server 2012 and Powerpivot. In his free time you will find him playing rugby, underwater or cooking

Hyoun Park is the Chief Research Officer of Blue Hill Research where he oversees day-to-day research operations, delivery and methodology focused on vendor and technology selection. In addition, Park covers analytics and enterprise mobility technologies as a noted advisor, social influencer, and practitioner. Park has been named as a top 10 Big Data, analytics, and mobility influencer including quotes in USA Today, the Los Angeles Times, and a wide variety of industry media sources.

Paul Bradley is a co-founder and Chief Scientist at MethodCare, overseeing the company’s research and development functions, including development of new processes, technologies, and products. In addition to keeping MethodCare at the forefront of predictive analytics, data mining advances, and industry trends, Paul works with various governmental agencies on advanced healthcare research that is leading to improved clinical results at reduced costs to patients, providers, and payers.
Previously, Paul led data mining algorithm implementations for a number of Microsoft divisions. He served as the data mining development lead at Revenue Science, Inc. (formerly Digimine, Inc.) and was a researcher in the Data Management, Explorations and Mining Group at Microsoft Research, where he helped develop data mining algorithms and components that shipped with SQL Server.

Wayne Winston is the John and Esther Reese Professor of Decision Sciences at the Kelley School of Business at Indiana University. He holds a BS in mathematics from M.I.T. and a PhD in operations research from Yale. He has won over 30 teaching awards, including the Top MBA teaching award (five times).
Wayne has written over a dozen books, including those on Operations Research, Practical Management Science, Excel 2010 Data Analysis, and Business Modeling and Mathletics. He has taught classes or consulted for many organizations, including Broadcom, Roll Global, Booz Allen, Deloitte, Ford, Pfizer, Microsoft, Cisco, Medtronic, US Army, Eli Lilly, 3M, and GM. He is also a two-time Jeopardy! Champion.

Wayne Winston is the John and Esther Reese Professor of Decision Sciences at the Kelley School of Business at Indiana University. He holds a BS in mathematics from M.I.T. and a PhD in operations research from Yale. He has won over 30 teaching awards, including the Top MBA teaching award (five times).
Wayne has written over a dozen books, including those on Operations Research, Practical Management Science, Excel 2010 Data Analysis, and Business Modeling and Mathletics. He has taught classes or consulted for many organizations, including Broadcom, Roll Global, Booz Allen, Deloitte, Ford, Pfizer, Microsoft, Cisco, Medtronic, US Army, Eli Lilly, 3M, and GM. He is also a two-time Jeopardy! Champion.

Mark specialises in the areas of Data Science, Analytics, Data Modeling, Data Warehousing, and Business Intelligence. As a consultant he works with national and international companies designing analytical systems. Mark is a well-recognized commentator on the computer world, publishing articles, white papers, and 10 books on database and BI technology. As an academic, Mark is the Emeritus Professor of Analytics at the University of Dundee where he teaches masters courses in BI and Data Scienc

Mark specialises in the areas of Data Science, Analytics, Data Modeling, Data Warehousing, and Business Intelligence. As a consultant he works with national and international companies designing analytical systems. Mark is a well-recognized commentator on the computer world, publishing articles, white papers, and 10 books on database and BI technology. As an academic, Mark is the Emeritus Professor of Analytics at the University of Dundee where he teaches masters courses in BI and Data Scienc

Dr. Artus Krohn-Grimberghe has been working with databases and data analysis since SQL Server 7.0, and has been immersed in advanced analytics topics for more than six years.
Dr. Krohn-Grimberghe is co-founder and CEO of LYTIQ GmbH in Germany, a start-up focused on predictive analytics for industry projects. He also works as assistant professor for Analytic Information Systems and Business Intelligence in Germany.
When he isn't consulting for predictive analytics clients, he is busy researching new scalable algorithms and teaching.

Dr. Artus Krohn-Grimberghe has been working with databases and data analysis since SQL Server 7.0, and has been immersed in advanced analytics topics for more than six years.
Dr. Krohn-Grimberghe is co-founder and CEO of LYTIQ GmbH in Germany, a start-up focused on predictive analytics for industry projects. He also works as assistant professor for Analytic Information Systems and Business Intelligence in Germany.
When he isn't consulting for predictive analytics clients, he is busy researching new scalable algorithms and teaching.

Dr. Cristian Vava is the CEO of Innovatorium Technologies Corp. Previously, he served as CTO of VSR Martin Engineering, in Germany, and as R&D VP of Eurotechnology, in Romania. He was also an Associate Professor at the University of Craiova, Romania, where he taught Instrumentation and Signal Processing.

Robert Skoglund – Microsoft Worldwide Business Intelligence Technical Community Lead and Technical Lead for Enterprise Services Big Data Strategy – has deep knowledge of the Microsoft products required for delivering enterprise-class BI and data warehousing solutions. With experience implementing both MSF and SCRUM project management principles, he has implemented successful BI, DW, system integration, and application development solutions. Robert joined Microsoft in 2001 and has worked in many client-facing consultancy roles in the retail, financial services, and manufacturing sectors.
A PASS member, Robert hosts a monthly BI User Group at the Microsoft office in his home town. He was one of the first independent Microsoft Certified Trainers (circa 1994), and regularly presents technical sessions at such events as TechReady, xDM, TechEd North America, and SharePoint Connections.

Kamal Hathi, Director of the BI Group for Microsoft SQL Server, is responsible for managing the overall strategy, design, development, and delivery of SQL Server business intelligence technologies. The foundation of Microsoft’s end-to-end BI solutions, SQL Server delivers an innovative platform and tools that help organizations worldwide easily build and deploy robust BI solutions at all scales with low total cost of ownership.
Since joining Microsoft in 1996, Kamal has served in engineering management roles in various product groups and was one of the founding members of Microsoft’s BI efforts. Prior to Microsoft, Kamal had a diverse work history, including experiences in research and consulting. He has a graduate degree in engineering from Case Western Reserve University.

Kamal Hathi, Director of the BI Group for Microsoft SQL Server, is responsible for managing the overall strategy, design, development, and delivery of SQL Server business intelligence technologies. The foundation of Microsoft’s end-to-end BI solutions, SQL Server delivers an innovative platform and tools that help organizations worldwide easily build and deploy robust BI solutions at all scales with low total cost of ownership.
Since joining Microsoft in 1996, Kamal has served in engineering management roles in various product groups and was one of the founding members of Microsoft’s BI efforts. Prior to Microsoft, Kamal had a diverse work history, including experiences in research and consulting. He has a graduate degree in engineering from Case Western Reserve University.

Tim Mallalieu is the Group Program Manager of the HDInsight team at Microsoft. In this role he is responsible for Microsoft’s Hadoop offerings. Over his tenure at Microsoft, Tim has had a variety of roles in the Developer and SQL divisions, primarily focused in the data programmability, languages, and application frameworks space.

Marc Reguera, an 18-year Microsoft veteran, leads the Finance teams in Services (for Customer Services and Support and Premier). Marc drives the revenue planning and analysis for the US sales organization and more recently optimized Microsoft spending in R&D and Marketing for the Server and Tools Division. He has also taught classes on data visualization and business storytelling to over 3,000 finance employees in the last 4 years and regularly meets with customers to showcase Microsoft BI capabilities.

Naga Krothapalli, Global Director of Analytics at Microsoft Advertising, is responsible for providing actionable insights and analytics to Microsoft Advertising customers, leveraging both internal and syndicated data. His team provides audience and campaign insights on various Microsoft products such as MSN, Bing, Windows Live, Skype, and Xbox, as well as competitive and vertical insights.
Previously, Naga was the Director of Operations at iProspect, where he was responsible for overall operations of the search engine optimization group and served as Director of Business Analytics. He has spoken at many events and has worked on research projects sponsored by NASA, DARPA, and the National Science Foundation. He holds a PhD in Industrial Engineering and Operations Research from the University of Massachusetts at Amherst.

Javier Torrenteras is a SolidQ Mentor focused on business intelligence. With more than 18 years of experience in the IT field, he has worked on a large variety of projects, including client/server and web development solutions, management systems, and business intelligence. Over the past 10 years, he has specialized in the Microsoft Data Platform, with primary focus on the BI tools. He is an MCTS and MCITP on SQL Server and coordinates the BI section of The SolidQ Journal.

Shaun Connolly has more than 20 years of experience in the software industry, with a track record of building early-stage and midsize software companies into successful market leaders. Shaun was previously VP of Product Strategy at VMware, where he focused on defining VMware’s cloud application platform vision. He has also held VP and Director-level positions at SpringSource, Red Hat, JBoss, Princeton Softech, HP, Bluestone Software, and Primavera Systems.

Michael Raheem is a BI and Data Warehousing Practice Director at Neudesic, with 20 years of experience in architecting and developing BI and data warehousing solutions. Michael’s experience includes identifying, developing, and deploying large database solutions on the Microsoft platform. Before joining Neudesic, he worked at Microsoft for 13 years, leading the design and development of SQL Server in areas of high availability, security, scalability, and business intelligence. Michael is a frequent speaker at industry conferences and has written several SQL Server books.

Carter Shanklin is a Director of Product Management at Hortonworks and focuses on Hadoop data interfaces, including Hive, Pig, and HBase. Before joining Hortonworks, Carter was product manager for VMware's in-memory databases, SQLFire and GemFire. Carter holds an M.S. in mathematics from George Mason University.

Ruben is a Global BI/BigData Manager and Global Data Lead Architect at DUFRY HQ, member of PASS Spanish Group and founder of SQLSaturday Barcelona and Madrid. MCP and MCSA in SQL Server 2012 and also awarded with Microsoft MVP Data Platform. With more than 9 years of experience, he has been working in top projects for leading worldwide companies and teaching in the SolidQ BI Master. He has presented at the SQL Server 2008 R2 and 2014 Spanish launch event, PASS BA Chicago, TechNet Webcasts, Microsoft Partner Program and SolidQ Summit events.

Dr. Marc A. Smith is a sociologist specializing in the social organization of online communities and computer mediated interaction. He leads the Connected Action consulting group and co-founded the Social Media Research Foundation, a non-profit devoted to open tools, data, and scholarship related to social media research. Marc is the co-editor of “Communities in Cyberspace” (Routledge) and co-author and editor of “Analyzing Social Media Networks with NodeXL” (Morgan-Kaufmann).
At Microsoft Research, Marc founded the Community Technologies Group and led development of the Netscan application and data mining engine for researchers studying Usenet newsgroups and related repositories of threaded conversations. He is an adjunct lecturer at the University of Maryland’s College of Information Studies and a Distinguished Visiting Scholar at Stanford University’s Media-X Program.

Dan Bulos is president and founder of Symmetry Corporation, a leading BI consulting firm and Microsoft Gold Certified Partner. He has over 25 years of experience consulting with Fortune 500 companies on using analytical systems and has provided strategic consulting on new product features and directions to leading software vendors. A featured speaker at BI and data warehouse conferences in the US and Europe, Dan is a recognized authority on multidimensional database technology.

Eron Kelly is a 12-year veteran of Microsoft with a broad set of experiences in product management across the Microsoft Office and Server and Tools divisions. He is currently the General Manager responsible for product marketing for Microsoft SQL Server and the Data Platform. In this capacity, he leads core product marketing, technical readiness, and value proposition for the Data Platform. Before leading the SQL Server product marketing team, he was a General Manager in the Windows Azure group, leading an incubation effort focused on Microsoft’s commerce platform.

Leif Brenne is a Lead Program Manager in the Office Data Experiences team, a team that’s responsible for delivering BI features in Office such as PivotTables, external data connectivity, PowerPivot, and Power View, as well as spreadsheet compliance features such as Discovery and Risk assessment for workbooks and databases. Prior to this, he’s played various roles within the Office and Microsoft Business Solutions since joining Microsoft in 2001, including working on PerformancePoint and Dynamic

Leif Brenne is a Lead Program Manager in the Office Data Experiences team, a team that’s responsible for delivering BI features in Office such as PivotTables, external data connectivity, PowerPivot, and Power View, as well as spreadsheet compliance features such as Discovery and Risk assessment for workbooks and databases. Prior to this, he’s played various roles within the Office and Microsoft Business Solutions since joining Microsoft in 2001, including working on PerformancePoint and Dynamic

Raman Iyer is a Development Manager in the SQL Server Business Intelligence group at Microsoft and one of the founding members of the SQL Server Data Mining team. Raman currently leads the development of next generation capabilities in SQL Server Analysis Services. Beyond data mining, his interests include Big Data technologies, distributed systems and NLP. Raman was a relational database guy prior to his venture into data mining and business intelligence - he has worked on the SQL Server Storage Engine team at Microsoft and on the Replication Server and database client products at Sybase Inc. Raman holds a bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering from the University of Pune in India and an MBA in Technology Management from the University of Washington in Seattle.

Sandy Rivas is a Program Manager for Power BI at Microsoft. A 17+ year Microsoft veteran, she has shipped numerous Microsoft products. She manages the Power BI online Community and Power BI User Groups across the world. Her real-world use of Power BI with her brother’s business has given her a keen insight to the practical uses and value of self-service BI. Sandy has a passion for empowering customers to master their data through self-service BI. Her practical experience & enthusiasm is contagious!

As a member of Intel’s Technology Manufacturing Engineering (TME) BI team, Eduardo has led the effort in defining, designing, implementing, and deploying TME’s Business Intelligence solution using Microsoft’s BI stack. He is a key contributor for the development and proliferation of new technologies and solutions as well as setting the strategic direction for the team with regard to next generation software tools, processes, and solutions for TME. He has extensive experience developing information systems to deliver value to Intel’s technical training and supply chain businesses.

Artin Avanes joined Microsoft in 2011 and is a program manager for SQL Server Parallel Data Warehouse. He is currently an improvement lead on the integration of NoSQL environments with PDW, such as the Hadoop integration via the Polybase project. He was also involved in developing the Hadoop connectors for both SQL Server and PDW and has worked on Distributed SQL and BI integration.
Previously, Artin served as research assistant for the database systems group at Humboldt Universitaet zu Berlin, Germany, bringing together ideas from database systems, distributed systems, artificial intelligence, and operation research and scheduling methods. He was also a research visitor at Stanford University’s Infolab. Artin holds a master’s degree in computer science and obtained his PhD in computer science in 2010.

Dianne is the lead developer of the largest SQL Server Analysis Services cube in the world. This cube is used at Yahoo and for doing deep-dive data analysis and optimization of ad campaigns. Dianne's background was in product management and product marketing for various internet start-ups in online advertising. But her underlying passion for databases and analytics drove her to move to the development side in 2006. She now brings together her insights into the needs of her customers with the love of building databases and cubes.

Dr. Mike Stringer is co-founder and managing partner of Datascope Analytics, a Chicago data-driven consulting and design firm. A leader in the data science industry, he speaks at conferences such as O'Reilly Strata, publishes articles in leading peer-reviewed journals such as Science, and governs the rapidly growing Chicago Data Science group. At Datascope Analytics, Mike has led and contributed to projects across a variety of industries for clients such as Procter & Gamble, Thomson Reuters, and other well-known companies. Stringer received a BS in Engineering Physics from the University of Colorado and a PhD in Physics from Northwestern University. Named a "Data Hero" by DataKind, Mike is passionate about using data to make a positive impact on business and society.

Dmitri Tchikatilov, a Technology Specialist in the Parallel Data Warehouse group at Microsoft, works closely with enterprise customers on delivering large-scale data management and analytics solutions for advertising and financial services industries. His interests and expertise include large-scale data analysis, BI, MPP appliances, and Big Data systems as well as predictive analysis and data mining. Dmitri has presented at a variety of .NET developer and SQL Server events, including PASS Summit. Before joining Microsoft, he worked as a fixed-income derivatives trader at a Wall Street firm. He holds a Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering from Columbia University in New York.

Anna Skobodzinski is a Technology Architect at the Microsoft Technology Center in New York, where she works with clients to envision, design, and proof solutions that meet specific customer needs. Microsoft Technology Centers provide staff with worldwide expertise and in-depth knowledge of Microsoft products and technologies. Anna holds a Master’s Degree in Computer Science and Engineering.

Gilad Elyashar is a Senior Program Manager with the SQL Server Business Intelligence group at Microsoft working on the Service Foundation team investigating and delivering are Self –Service BI scenarios in the SharePoint Online cloud environment including PowerPivot and Power View.

David Magar is a Program Manager with the SQL Server Business Intelligence group at Microsoft working on the Azure SQL Reporting team, investigating and delivering different cloud BI features in the form of Platform as a Service.

Antonio Zurlo, Senior Program Manager in Microsoft’s Azure Customer Experience team, has more than 15 years’ experience implementing large-scale, distributed systems for the financial services and insurance industries. His experience includes building high-performance computing (HPC)/Grid infrastructures, object-oriented middleware, and virtualization environments for some of the largest investment banks in the world. Antonio’s current focus is on Big Data and Big Compute solutions on Azure.
Before joining Microsoft, Antonio worked for Platform Computing, now an IBM company specializing in Grid Computing. He has also worked as a trading-system architect at Goldman Sachs, Lehman Brothers, and Bear Stearns. Antonio holds a Master’s degree in Computer Science from the University of Pisa, Italy.

Trevor Attridge is responsible for MEC’s global technology strategy and vision, driving technology-enabled marketing solutions. With more than 15 years’ experience leading conceptualization, design, and implementation of technology that drives performance, awareness, and deep understanding of the consumer, Trevor’s understanding of technology, marketing, and client needs has resulted in successful projects covering all aspects of media and marketing. Part of the global technology steering committee, Trevor’s work extends beyond MEC across GroupM and its agencies.
Trevor joined MEC from Aegis Media, where he served as CTO and Global Programmes and Change Director, responsible for strategies around operational and client-facing technologies. He’s also held senior pan-European roles at Young & Rubicam, Wunderman, and WPP, delivering technological solutions that advanced the agencies during the dot.com era.

With 20+ years of experience with BI and data analytics, Avi Perez has architected and delivered a number of innovative solutions for the Microsoft BI stack. He now leads an agile development team at Pyramid Analytics that is building a breakthrough analytics, dashboarding, and reporting platform for the Microsoft BI stack.

As Digital Operations Director and Partner at MEC, Christian Bonilla is responsible for delivering on MEC’s digital data vision, guiding analysts and database experts as they implement innovative work for their clients. In helping shape MEC’s digital data vision, Christian has created and optimized processes and structures for easier data collection and processing and investigated solutions for working with Big Data, ultimately selecting ground-breaking PDW technology.
Christian’s background spans multiple marketing disciplines over 7 years at agencies in the US. He began in IT before switching to market-mix modeling and advertising and then ultimately focusing on digital analytics and data. He hails from Cornell University, where he studied Operations Research and Industrial Engineering and acquired his penchant for streamlining and optimizing processes.

Seayoung Rhee is a Sr. Technical Product Manager in the Advanced Analytics marketing team. Joining Microsoft in 2006, he has been responsible for worldwide marketing content, product strategy and positioning, and technical readiness for business intelligence, machine learning and advanced analytics.

John Whittaker is the director of product marketing at Quest Software (now a part of Dell) within the database management practice. John has over 20 years of experience in high-tech organizations, previously holding positions with companies such as AlertSource, Trinent Internet Solutions, and KnowledgeCentrix, among others. His particular areas of expertise include database management, information security, business continuity and disaster recovery planning, managed services, and e-commerce.

Ben Boise has been with Quest Software (now a part of Dell) since June 2007 working in the PreSales group as a Systems Consultant. Ben has over 12 years in IT and has worn numerous hats during this time. He has experience in Systems Support, Software Testing, Software Development and Professional Services.

Enrique Moreno is responsible of Corporate Information Systems in Atento, multinational leader in Contact Center and BPO with operations in 16 countries, providing customer support to hundreds of millions of people.
Enrique has lead successfully transformation projects involving different technologies and architectures in his 15 years’ experience as IT Manager and Software Architect.

Ari is on the Office and Office 365 Technical Product Marketing team at Microsoft that works closely with engineering on prioritizing and messaging features in the new versions of Office applications. He is specifically responsible for marketing Excel and Business Intelligence. He has been driving disclosure for Power Map (formerly known as codename "GeoFlow") Preview for Excel and has demoed for press, analysts, and customers. He is excited to be getting the word out about Power Map and other Self-Service BI features in Excel.

Bill is a SQL Server consultant focusing on availability, performance, security, and developer support. He has nearly 20 years for experience supporting a wide variety of SQL Server installations.
He is a former President of PASS where he served on the Board for ten years. Bill was a SQL Server MVP for the previous thirteen years. He is the publisher of SQLTeam.com where his SQL Server articles have been read by DBA’s and developers all around the globe.
Bill is the author of two popular free SQL Server utilities: ClearTrace for analyzing SQL Server performance traces and Is It SQL? that provides simple SQL Server monitoring.

Matt Wolken is GM of the Information Management domain in the new Dell Software Group. Dell Software’s Information Management tool suite lets mid-size firms simplify complex data environments and unlock the power of information. Supported by one of the analytic industry’s largest user communities, Dell’s “one vendor – one tool chain – all data” approach enables organizations to more easily manage, integrate, and analyze data to inform business decisions, increase innovation, and drive new revenue streams.
Previously, Matt led Dell’s software strategy in its early planning stages and in its initial stages after the Dell Software Group was launched. He’s worked at several of the industry’s bellwether companies – including Intel, Sun Microsystems, NEC Corporation, and BMC – and has an MBA from the University of Texas at Austin.

Amir Netz is a Technical Fellow at Microsoft. He is CTO of Power BI & Intelligence Platform products and services. He is a leading expert in BI and business analytics technology, holding over 40 patents. Some of his contributions include VertiPaq – an in-memory column-oriented data engine that excels at performance and flexibility for data analysis, PowerPivot – a breakthrough self-service BI capability for Excel and SharePoint.

Steven Levitt, bestselling author of Freakonomics and SuperFreakonomics, is a tenured professor in the University of Chicago’s economics department and the recipient of the American Economic Association’s prestigious John Bates Clark Medal, which recognizes the most influential economist in America under the age of 40. He was also named one of Time magazine’s “100 People Who Shape Our World.”
Originally published in the US in 2005, Freakonomics spent more than 2 years on The New York Times bestseller list, having sold more than 4 million copies around the world, in more than 30 languages. Steven received his B.A. from Harvard University in 1989, his Ph.D. from M.I.T. in 1994, and has taught at Chicago since 1997.

Drew Minkin is Vice President of Advanced Analytics for Halo BI. Drew has been on the leading edge of Microsoft SQL, predictive analytics and business intelligence. He has built predictive models and advanced analytic solutions for leading retail, energy, healthcare, manufacturing and financial services in Europe, Asia, Australia and North America. Drew worked for the Microsoft SQL Server product group, supporting and mentoring leading-edge business analytics at Fortune 100 companies, as an owner of a predictive analytics practice and a lecturer at the Cox School of Business, Southern Methodist University. He was also the predictive modeler and solution architect for Predixion Readmission Insight™ – winner of the Microsoft Health Users Group 2013 Innovation Award, EMR Optimization category.
